meanings.definition: Arranged in a systematic or orderly manner.
meanings.sent1: The taxitic rows of books in the library made it easy to find what I needed.
meanings.sent2: The taxitic arrangement of the flowers in the garden created a beautiful display.
meanings.sent3: The taxitic way the ducks lined up to get their food was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: Her taxitic approach to organizing her schedule was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The taxitic layout of the classroom helped students focus on their work.

meanings.definition: Showing a tendency to move or react in a certain way.
meanings.sent1: The taxitic behavior of the ants marching in a line fascinated the children.
meanings.sent2: His taxitic response to stress was to take a deep breath and remain calm.
meanings.sent3: The taxitic way the cat pounced on the toy mouse was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: Her taxitic reflexes in catching the ball amazed everyone watching.
meanings.sent5: The taxitic way the leaves fell from the tree in a gentle dance was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to taxis or taxis.
meanings.sent1: The taxitic signs at the airport guided travelers to the taxi stand.
meanings.sent2: Her taxitic knowledge of the city's taxi routes helped her navigate easily.
meanings.sent3: The taxitic way the taxi driver honked his horn made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The taxitic speed at which the taxi arrived surprised the passengers.
meanings.sent5: The taxitic fare for the taxi ride was reasonable and fair.
